turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: --Well, I suppose the--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Whom do you think... you must have some idea who is complaining about these Indian lotteries.

turn.speaker: roderick_eugene_walston
turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: --Actually, there are very few complaints about charitable bingo.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: This is just an energetic local prosecutor in Riverside County?

turn.speaker: roderick_eugene_walston
turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: Are you talking now about the tribal games or the charitable games?

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: No, the tribal games.

turn.speaker: roderick_eugene_walston
turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: Oh, the tribal games are--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Who is complaining about it?

turn.speaker: roderick_eugene_walston
turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: --are opposed by a wide number of law enforcement agencies in California.
As a matter of fact, the--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: All right, but they just don't do it on their own, do they?

turn.speaker: roderick_eugene_walston
turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: --Well, they feel very strongly about it, Your Honor.
In fact, the last--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: They must... a lot of them are elected, aren't they?

turn.speaker: roderick_eugene_walston
turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: --Well, they are, and when the new fellow gets elected he comes in and complains it, too.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Well, what part of his constituency is complaining?
Charities?

turn.speaker: roderick_eugene_walston
turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: The charities themselves are--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Are really--

turn.speaker: roderick_eugene_walston
turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: --Yes.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: --There is competition.
There is real competition, isn't there?

turn.speaker: roderick_eugene_walston
turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: Yes.
That is actually correct.
As a matter of fact, I recall the situation in Arizona--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: So I wouldn't think a local prosecutor would get so excited unless there might be a question of votes or something.

turn.speaker: roderick_eugene_walston
turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: --Well, I... no, there is a vast opposition to charitable... tribal bingo in California, and much of the opposition--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: From the charities.

turn.speaker: roderick_eugene_walston
turn.label: Mr. Roderick Eugene Walston
turn.text: --does indeed come from charities.

In fact, I am familiar with the situation in Arizona involving the St. Keno Learning School that was dependent strictly upon charitable... or I should... yes, charitable bingo proceeds, and it was forced to shut down simply because of the competition from the tribal games in Arizona.

The tribes have also made the argument that the tribes need high stakes bingo in order to effectively survive and obtain revenue for tribal purposes and that they have no real options other than tribal bingo.

Well, President Reagan's policy statement on which the tribes have relied so heavily in this case indicates that a number of other types of options are available to the tribes to generate revenues for tribal purposes, and these purposes are listed at Pages 226 and 227 of the joint appendix, and they are as follows: manufacturing, agri-business, and modern technology; second... I am sorry, my time is up.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Chief Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: Your time has expired, Mr. Walston.
The case is submitted.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: The Honorable Court is now adjourned until tomorrow at 10 o'clock.
